intro: Malvastrum fremontii var. orbiculatum, commonly known as the Fremont's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its broad, orbicular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its fibrous roots and hairy stems are adaptations to arid environments, and it is part of the Malvaceae family. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native pollinators.
